overview:
## Discussion

At any time after [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] is called, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] can be called to continue speaking from the beginning of the word at which speech paused.

Sending [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] to a receiver that is not currently in a paused state has no effect on the synthesizer or on future calls to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] function. If you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] on a synthesizer before a pause is effective, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] cancels the pause.

If the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] method stopped speech in the middle of a word, the synthesizer will start speaking that word from the beginning when you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()].

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()
crawled: 2025-12-04T11:04:26Z

# continueSpeaking()

**Instance Method**

Resumes synthesis.

## Declaration

```swift
func continueSpeaking()
```

## Discussion

At any time after [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] is called, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] can be called to continue speaking from the beginning of the word at which speech paused.

Sending [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] to a receiver that is not currently in a paused state has no effect on the synthesizer or on future calls to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] function. If you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] on a synthesizer before a pause is effective, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()] cancels the pause.

If the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] method stopped speech in the middle of a word, the synthesizer will start speaking that word from the beginning when you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/continueSpeaking()].

## Synthesizing Speech

- **isSpeaking**: Indicates whether the receiver is currently generating synthesized speech.
- **startSpeaking(_:)**: Begins speaking synthesized text through the system’s default sound output device.
- **startSpeaking(_:to:)**: Begins synthesizing text into a sound (AIFF) file.
- **pauseSpeaking(at:)**: Pauses synthesis in progress at a given boundary.
- **stopSpeaking()**: Stops synthesis in progress.
- **stopSpeaking(at:)**: Stops synthesis in progress at a given boundary.
- **NSSpeechSynthesizer.Boundary**: These constants are used to indicate where speech should be stopped and paused. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/pauseSpeaking(at:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpeechSynthesizer/stopSpeaking(at:)].
